field.name: SEQA_INT
field.description: Sequence A interrupt/DMA trigger. If the MODE bit in the SEQA_CTRL register is 0, this flag will mirror the DATAVALID bit in the sequence A global data register (SEQA_GDAT), which is set at the end of every ADC conversion performed as part of sequence A. It will be cleared automatically when the SEQA_GDAT register is read. If the MODE bit in the SEQA_CTRL register is 1, this flag will be set upon completion of an entire A sequence. In this case it must be cleared by writing a 1 to this SEQA_INT bit. This interrupt must be enabled in the INTEN register.

field.name: SEQB_INT
field.description: Sequence A interrupt/DMA trigger. If the MODE bit in the SEQB_CTRL register is 0, this flag will mirror the DATAVALID bit in the sequence A global data register (SEQB_GDAT), which is set at the end of every ADC conversion performed as part of sequence B. It will be cleared automatically when the SEQB_GDAT register is read. If the MODE bit in the SEQB_CTRL register is 1, this flag will be set upon completion of an entire B sequence. In this case it must be cleared by writing a 1 to this SEQB_INT bit. This interrupt must be enabled in the INTEN register.

field.name: THCMP_INT
field.description: Threshold Comparison Interrupt. This bit will be set if any of the THCMP flags in the lower bits of this register are set to 1 (due to an enabled out-of-range or threshold-crossing event on any channel). Each type of threshold comparison interrupt on each channel must be individually enabled in the INTEN register to cause this interrupt. This bit will be cleared when all of the individual threshold flags are cleared via writing 1s to those bits.

field.name: OVR_INT
field.description: Overrun Interrupt flag. Any overrun bit in any of the individual channel data registers will cause this interrupt. In addition, if the MODE bit in either of the SEQn_CTRL registers is 0 then the OVERRUN bit in the corresponding SEQn_GDAT register will also cause this interrupt. This interrupt must be enabled in the INTEN register. This bit will be cleared when all of the individual overrun bits have been cleared via reading the corresponding data registers.

register.name: STARTUP
register.description: ADC Startup Register (typically only used by the ADC API).

field.name: ADC_ENA
field.description: ADC Enable bit. This bit can only be set to a 1 by software. It is cleared automatically whenever the ADC is powered down. This bit must not be set until at least 10 microseconds after the ADC is powered up (typically by altering a system-level ADC power control bit).

field.name: ADC_INT
field.description: tbd

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: CALIB
field.description: Calibration request. Setting this bit will launch an ADC calibration cycle. This bit can only be set to a 1 by software. It is cleared automatically when the calibration cycle completes.

field.name: CALREQD
field.description: Calibration required. This read-only bit indicates if calibration is required when enabling the ADC. CALREQD will be 1 if no calibration has been run since the chip was powered-up and if the BYPASSCAL bit in the ADCTRL register is low. The ADC API will test this bit to determine whether to initiate a calibration cycle or whether to set the ADC_INIT bit (in the ADSTARTUP register) to launch the ADC initialization process which includes a dummy conversion cycle. Note: A dummy conversion cycle requires approximately 6 ADC clocks as opposed to 81 clocks required for calibration.

field.name: CALVALUE
field.description: Calibration Value. This read-only field displays the calibration value established during last calibration cycle. This value is not typically of any use to the user.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: FIFOCTLUSART
register.description: USART FIFO global control register. These registers are byte, halfword, and word addressable.The upper 16 bits of these registers provide information about the System FIFO configuration, and are specific to each device type.

field.name: RXPAUSE
field.description: Pause all USARTs receive FIFO operations. This can be used to prepare the System FIFO to reconfigure FIFO allocations among the USART receivers.

field.name: RXPAUSED
field.description: All USART receive FIFOs are paused.

field.name: RXEMPTY
field.description: All USART receive FIFOs are empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXPAUSE
field.description: Pause all USARTs transmit FIFO operations. This can be used to prepare the System FIFO to reconfigure FIFO allocations among the USART transmitters.

field.name: TXPAUSED
field.description: All USART transmit FIFOs are paused.

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: All USART transmit FIFOs are empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXFIFOTOTAL
field.description: Reports the receive FIFO space available for USARTs on this FIFO. The reset value is device specific.

field.name: TXFIFOTOTAL
field.description: Reports the transmit FIFO space available for USARTs on this FIFO. The reset value is device specific.

field.name: USART0RXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART0 Rx FIFO size to match the USART0 RXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART RXSIZE is changed.

field.name: USART1RXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART1 Rx FIFO size to match the USART1 RXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART RXSIZE is changed.

field.name: USART2RXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART2 Rx FIFO size to match the USART2 RXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART RXSIZE is changed.

field.name: USART3RXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART3 Rx FIFO size to match the USART3 RXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART RXSIZE is changed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: USART0TXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART0 Tx FIFO size to match the USART0 TXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART TXSIZE is changed.

field.name: USART1TXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART1 Tx FIFO size to match the USART1 TXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART TXSIZE is changed.

field.name: USART2TXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART2 Tx FIFO size to match the USART2 TXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART TXSIZE is changed.

field.name: USART3TXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates USART3 Tx FIFO size to match the USART3 TXSIZE. Must be done for all USARTs when any USART TXSIZE is changed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXSIZE
field.description: Configures the USART receive FIFO size. A zero values provides no System FIFO service for the related USART receiver.

field.name: TXSIZE
field.description: Configures the USART transmit FIFO size. A zero values provides no System FIFO service for the related USART transmitter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: FIFOCTLSPI
register.description: SPI FIFO global control register. These registers are byte, halfword, and word addressable. The upper 16 bits of these registers provide information about the System FIFO configuration, and are specific to each device type.

field.name: RXPAUSE
field.description: Pause all SPIs receive FIFO operations. This can be used to prepare the System FIFO to reconfigure FIFO allocations among the SPI receivers.

field.name: RXPAUSED
field.description: All SPI receive FIFOs are paused.

field.name: RXEMPTY
field.description: All SPI receive FIFOs are empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXPAUSE
field.description: Pause all SPIs transmit FIFO operations. This can be used to prepare the System FIFO to reconfigure FIFO allocations among the SPI transmitters.

field.name: TXPAUSED
field.description: All SPI transmit FIFOs are paused.

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: All SPI transmit FIFOs are empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXFIFOTOTAL
field.description: Reports the receive FIFO space available for SPIs on the System FIFO. The reset value is device specific.

field.name: TXFIFOTOTAL
field.description: Reports the transmit FIFO space available for SPIs on the System FIFO. The reset value is device specific.

field.name: SPI0RXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates SPI0 Rx FIFO size to match the SPI0 RXSIZE. Must be done for all SPIs when any SPI RXSIZE is changed.

field.name: SPI1RXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates SPI1 Rx FIFO size to match the SPI1 RXSIZE. Must be done for all SPIs when any SPI RXSIZE is changed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SPI0TXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates SPI0 Tx FIFO size to match the SPI0 TXSIZE. Must be done for all SPIs when any SPI TXSIZE is changed.

field.name: SPI1TXUPDATESIZE
field.description: Writing 1 updates SPI1 Tx FIFO size to match the SPI1 TXSIZE. Must be done for all SPIs when any SPI TXSIZE is changed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXSIZE
field.description: Configures the SPI receive FIFO size. A zero values provides no System FIFO service for the related SPI receiver.

field.name: TXSIZE
field.description: Configures the SPI transmit FIFO size. A zero values provides no System FIFO service for the related SPI transmitter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TIMEOUTCONTONWRITE
field.description: Timeout Continue On Write. When 0, the timeout for the related peripheral is reset every time data is transferred from the peripheral into the receive FIFO. When 1, the timeout for the related peripheral is not reset every time data is transferred into the receive FIFO. This allows the timeout to be applied to accumulated data, perhaps related to the FIFO threshold.

field.name: TIMEOUTCONTONEMPTY
field.description: Timeout Continue On Empty. When 0, the timeout for the related peripheral is reset when the receive FIFO becomes empty. When 1, the timeout for the related peripheral is not reset when the receive FIFO becomes empty. This allows the timeout to be used to flag idle peripherals, and could potentially be used to indicate the end of a transmission of indeterminate length.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TIMEOUTBASE
field.description: Specifies the least significant timer bit to compare to TimeoutValue. See Section 24.5.7.1 below. Value can be 0 through 15.

field.name: TIMEOUTVALUE
field.description: Specifies the maximum time value for timeout at the timer position identified by TimeoutBase. Minimum time TimeoutValue - 1. is See Section 24.5.7.1 below. TimeoutValue should not be 0 or 1 when timeout is enabled.

field.name: RXTHRESHOLD
field.description: Receive FIFO Threshold. The System FIFO indicates that the threshold has been reached when the number of entries in the receive FIFO is greater than this value. For example, when RxThreshold = 0, the threshold is exceeded when there is at least one entry in the receive FIFO. An interrupt can be generated when the RxThreshold has been reached (see Section 24.5.10), but has no effect on DMA requests, which are generated whenever the receiver FIFO is not empty.

field.name: TXTHRESHOLD
field.description: Transmit FIFO Threshold. The System FIFO indicates that the threshold has been reached when the number of free entries in the transmit FIFO is less than or equal to this value. For example, when TxThreshold = 0, the threshold is exceeded when there is at least one free entry in the transmit FIFO. An interrupt can be generated when the TxThreshold has been reached (see Section 24.5.10), but has no effect on DMA requests, which are generated whenever the transmit FIFO has any free entries.

field.name: RXTH
field.description: Receive FIFO Threshold. When 1, the receive FIFO threshold has been reached. This is a read-only bit.

field.name: TXTH
field.description: Transmit FIFO Threshold. When 1, the transmit FIFO threshold has been reached. This is a read-only bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXTIMEOUT
field.description: Receive FIFO Timeout. When 1, the receive FIFO has timed out, based on the timeout configuration in the CFGUSART register. The timeout condition can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit, by enabling or disabling the timeout interrupt, or by writing a 1 to the timeout interrupt enable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: BUSERR
field.description: Bus Error. When 1, a bus error has occurred while processing data for USARTn. The bus error flag can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

field.name: RXEMPTY
field.description: Receive FIFO Empty. When 1, the receive FIFO is currently empty. This is a read-only bit.

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. When 1, the transmit FIFO is currently empty. This is a read-only bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXCOUNT
field.description: Receive FIFO Count. Indicates how many entries may be read from the receive FIFO. 0 = FIFO empty. This is a read-only field.

field.name: TXCOUNT
field.description: Transmit FIFO Count. Indicates how many entries may be written to the transmit FIFO. 0 = FIFO full. This is a read-only field that is valid only when the TxFIFO is fully configured and enabled.

field.name: RXTH
field.description: Receive FIFO Threshold. When 1, the receive FIFO threshold has been reached, and the related interrupt is enabled.

field.name: TXTH
field.description: Transmit FIFO Threshold. When 1, the transmit FIFO threshold has been reached, and the related interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXTIMEOUT
field.description: Receive Timeout. When 1, the receive FIFO has timed out, based on the timeout configuration in the CFGUSART register, and the related interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: BUSERR
field.description: Bus Error. This is simply a copy of the same bit in the STATUSART register. The bus error interrupt is always enabled.

field.name: RXEMPTY
field.description: Receive FIFO Empty. This is simply a copy of the same bit in the STATUSART register.

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This is simply a copy of the same bit in the STATUSART register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXCOUNT
field.description: Receive FIFO Count. This is simply a copy of the same field in the STATUSART register, included here so an ISR can read all needed status information in one read.

field.name: TXCOUNT
field.description: Transmit FIFO Available. This is simply a copy of the same field in the STATUSART register, included here so an ISR can read all needed status information in one read.

register.name: CTLSETUSART%s
register.description: USART0 control read and set register. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXTHINTEN
field.description: Receive FIFO Threshold Interrupt Enable.

field.name: TXTHINTEN
field.description: Transmit FIFO Threshold Interrupt Enable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXTIMEOUTINTEN
field.description: Receive FIFO Timeout Interrupt Enable. When enabled, this also enables the timeout for this USART. Writing a 1 to this bit resets the USART timeout logic.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXFLUSH
field.description: Receive FIFO flush. Writing a 1 to this bit forces the receive FIFO to be empty.

field.name: TXFLUSH
field.description: Transmit FIFO flush. Writing a 1 to this bit forces the transmit FIFO to be empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTLCLRUSART%s
register.description: USART0 control clear register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit in the related CTLSET register to be cleared.

field.name: RXTHINTCLR
field.description: Receive FIFO Threshold Interrupt clear.

field.name: TXTHINTCLR
field.description: Transmit FIFO Threshold Interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXTIMEOUTINTCLR
field.description: Receive FIFO Time-out Interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXFLUSHCLR
field.description: Receive FIFO flush clear.

field.name: TXFLUSHCLR
field.description: Transmit FIFO flush clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The UART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the UART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The UART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the UART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will set when the character in RXDAT was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Writing to the UART Transmit Data Register causes the data to be transmitted as soon as the transmit shift register is available and the condition for transmitting data is met: TXDIS bit = 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only zero should be written.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TIMEOUTCONTONWRITE
field.description: Timeout Continue On Write. When 0, the timeout for the related peripheral is reset every time data is transferred from the peripheral into the receive FIFO. When 1, the timeout for the related peripheral is not reset every time data is transferred into the receive FIFO. This allows the timeout to be applied to accumulated data, perhaps related to the FIFO threshold.

field.name: TIMEOUTCONTONEMPTY
field.description: Timeout Continue On Empty. When 0, the timeout for the related peripheral is reset when the receive FIFO becomes empty. When 1, the timeout for the related peripheral is not reset when the receive FIFO becomes empty. This allows the timeout to be used to flag idle peripherals, and could potentially be used to indicate the end of a transmission of indeterminate length.

An interrupt can be generated when the RxThreshold has been reached, but has no effect on DMA requests, which are generated whenever the receiver FIFO is not empty.

For example, when TxThreshold = 0, the threshold is exceeded when there is at least one free entry in the transmit FIFO. An interrupt can be generated when the TxThreshold has been reached, but has no effect on DMA requests, which are generated whenever the transmit FIFO has any free entries.

field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bit or bits in the CTLSETSPI register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in CTLSETSPI are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

register.name: RXDATSPI%s
register.description: SPI0 received data. These registers are half word addressable.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: Receiver Data. This contains the next piece of received data. The number of bits that are used depends on the LEN setting in TXCTL / TXDATCTL.

field.name: RXSSEL0_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL0 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL0 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL1_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL1 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL1 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL2_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL2 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL2 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL3_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL3 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL3 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: SOT
field.description: Start of Transfer flag. This flag will be 1 if this is the first data after the SSELs went from deasserted to asserted (i.e., any previous transfer has ended). This information can be used to identify the first piece of data in cases where the transfer length is greater than 16 bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TXDATSPI%s
register.description: SPI0 transmit data. These registers are half word addressable.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 1 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: TXSSEL0_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL0 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL0 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Asserted. SSEL0 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not asserted. SSEL0 not asserted.

field.name: TXSSEL1_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL1 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL1 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Asserted. SSEL1 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not asserted. SSEL1 not asserted.

field.name: TXSSEL2_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL2 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL2 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Asserted. SSEL2 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not asserted. SSEL2 not asserted.

field.name: TXSSEL3_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL3 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL3 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Asserted. SSEL3 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not asserted. SSEL3 not asserted.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer. The asserted SSEL will be deasserted at the end of a transfer, and remain so for at least the time specified by the Transfer_delay value in the DLY register.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not deasserted. SSEL not deasserted. This piece of data is not treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will not be deasserted at the end of this data.

enumeratedValue.name: DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Deasserted. SSEL deasserted. This piece of data is treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will be deasserted at the end of this piece of data.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame. Between frames, a delay may be inserted, as defined by the FRAME_DELAY value in the DLY register. The end of a frame may not be particularly meaningful if the FRAME_DELAY value = 0. This control can be used as part of the support for frame lengths greater than 16 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_NOT_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data not EOF. This piece of data transmitted is not treated as the end of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data EOF. This piece of data is treated as the end of a frame, causing the FRAME_DELAY time to be inserted before subsequent data is transmitted.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore. This allows data to be transmitted using the SPI without the need to read unneeded data from the receiver to simplify the transmit process and can be used with the DMA.

enumeratedValue.name: READ_RECEIVED_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: Read received data. Received data must be read in order to allow transmission to progress. In slave mode, an overrun error will occur if received data is not read before new data is received.

enumeratedValue.name: IGNORE_RECEIVED_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: Ignore received data. Received data is ignored, allowing transmission without reading unneeded received data. No receiver flags are generated.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: LEN
field.description: Data Length. Specifies the data length from 1 to 16 bits. Note that transfer lengths greater than 16 bits are supported by implementing multiple sequential data transmits. 0x0 = Data transfer is 1 bit in length. 0x1 = Data transfer is 2 bits in length. 0x2 = Data transfer is 3 bits in length. ... 0xF = Data transfer is 16 bits in length.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MAP

enumeratedValue.name: USER_RAM_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: User RAM Mode. Interrupt vectors are re-mapped to Static RAM.

enumeratedValue.name: USER_FLASH_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: User Flash Mode. Interrupt vectors are not re-mapped and reside in Flash.

field.description: NDEC reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the NDEC value is loaded into the PLL. Must be cleared by software for any subsequent load, or the PLL can be powered down and back up via the PDEN_SYS_PLL bit in the PDRUNCFG register if the NDEC value is changed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: PDEC
field.description: Decoded P-divider coefficient value

field.name: PREQ
field.description: PDEC reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the PDEC value is loaded into the PLL. Must be cleared by software for any subsequent load, or the PLL can be powered down and back up via the PDEN_SYS_PLL bit in the PDRUNCFG register if the PDEC value is changed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MDEC
field.description: Decoded M-divider coefficient value

field.name: MREQ
field.description: MDEC reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the MDEC value is loaded into the PLL. Must be cleared by software for any subsequent load, or the PLL can be powered down and back up via the PDEN_SYS_PLL bit in the PDRUNCFG register if the MDEC value is changed.

field.name: SEL_EXT
field.description: Select spread spectrum mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SPREAD_SPECTRUM_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Spread spectrum mode. Spread spectrum mode enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MDEC_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: MDEC enabled. Spread spectrum clock generator not used.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MD
field.description: M- divider value with fraction. MD[18:11] : integer portion of the feedback divider value. MD[10:0] : fractional portion of the feedback divider value.

field.name: MDREQ
field.description: MD reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the MD value is loaded into the PLL. This bit is cleared when the load is complete.

field.name: MF
field.description: Programmable modulation frequency fm = Fref/Nss with Fref = Fin/N 0b000 => Nss = 512 (fm = 3.9 - 7.8 kHz) 0b001 => Nss = 384 (fm = 5.2 - 10.4 kHz) 0b010 => Nss = 256 (fm = 7.8 - 15.6 kHz) 0b011 => Nss = 128 (fm = 15.6 - 31.3 kHz) 0b100 => Nss = 64 (fm = 32.3 - 64.5 kHz) 0b101 => Nss = 32 (fm = 62.5- 125 kHz) 0b110 => Nss = 24 (fm = 83.3- 166.6 kHz) 0b111 => Nss = 16 (fm = 125- 250 kHz)

field.name: MR
field.description: Programmable frequency modulation depth deltafmodpk-pk = Fref x k/Fcco = k/MDdec 0 = no spread 0b000 => k = 0 (no spread spectrum) 0b001 => k = 1 0b010 => k = 1.5 0b011 => k = 2 0b100 => k = 3 0b101 => k = 4 0b110 => k = 6 0b111 => k = 8

field.name: MC
field.description: Modulation waveform control 0 = no compensation Compensation for low pass filtering of the PLL to get a triangular modulation at the output of the PLL, giving a flat frequency spectrum. 0b00 => no compensation 0b10 => recommended setting 0b11 => max. compensation

field.name: PD
field.description: Power down.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Spread spectrum controller is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Spread spectrum controller is disabled

field.name: DITHER
field.description: Select modulation frequency.

enumeratedValue.name: FIXED
enumeratedValue.description: Fixed. Fixed modulation frequency.

enumeratedValue.name: DITHER
enumeratedValue.description: Dither. Randomly dither between two modulation frequencies.

field.name: MASTERCPU
field.description: Determines which CPU is considered the master. The master CPU cannot have its clock turned off via the related CMnCLKEN bit or be reset via the related CMxRSTEN in this register. The slave CPU wakes up briefly following device reset, then goes back to sleep until activated by the master CPU.

enumeratedValue.name: M0P
enumeratedValue.description: M0+. Cortex-M0+ is the master CPU.

enumeratedValue.name: M4
enumeratedValue.description: M4. Cortex-M4 is the master CPU.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written..

register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

field.name: MR0INT

field.name: MR1INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

field.name: MR2INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

field.name: MR3INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

field.name: CR1INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

field.name: CR3INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 3 event.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: TCR
register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

field.name: CEN
field.description: Counter enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled.The counters are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled.

field.name: CRST
field.description: Counter reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Do nothing.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: TC
register.description: Timer Counter. The 32 bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

field.name: TCVAL
field.description: Timer counter value.

register.name: PR
register.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (PC) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

field.name: PRVAL
field.description: Prescale counter value.

register.name: PC
register.description: Prescale Counter. The 32 bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

field.name: PCVAL
field.description: Prescale counter value.

register.name: MCR
register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

field.name: MR0I
field.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR0R
field.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR0S
field.description: Stop on MR0: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR1I
field.description: Interrupt on MR1: an interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR1R
field.description: Reset on MR1: the TC will be reset if MR1 matches it. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR1S
field.description: Stop on MR1: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR2I
field.description: Interrupt on MR2: an interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR2R
field.description: Reset on MR2: the TC will be reset if MR2 matches it. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR2S
field.description: Stop on MR2: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR3I
field.description: Interrupt on MR3: an interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR3R
field.description: Reset on MR3: the TC will be reset if MR3 matches it. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: MR3S
field.description: Stop on MR3: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: MR%s
register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

field.name: MATCH
field.description: Timer counter match value.

register.name: CCR
register.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

field.name: CAP0RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 0: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP0FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 0: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP0I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 0 capture event: a CR0 load generates an interrupt.

field.name: CAP1RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 1: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP1FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 1: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP1I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 1 capture event: a CR1 load generates an interrupt.

field.name: CAP2RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 2: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR2 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP2FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 2: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR2 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP2I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 2 capture event: a CR2 load generates an interrupt.

field.name: CAP3RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 3: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR3 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP3FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 3: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR3 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP3I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 3 capture event: a CR3 load generates an interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CR%s
register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CAPn.0 input.

field.name: CAP
field.description: Timer counter capture value.

register.name: EMR
register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins.

field.name: EM0
field.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by EMR[5:4]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EM1
field.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by EMR[7:6]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EM2
field.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of output MAT2, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by EMR[9:8]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EM3
field.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output MAT3, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by MR[11:10]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EMC0
field.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

enumeratedValue.name: DO_NOTHING
enumeratedValue.description: Do Nothing.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT0 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT0 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC1
field.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DO_NOTHING
enumeratedValue.description: Do Nothing.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT1 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT1 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC2
field.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

enumeratedValue.name: DO_NOTHING
enumeratedValue.description: Do Nothing.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT2 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT2 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC3
field.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

enumeratedValue.name: DO_NOTHING
enumeratedValue.description: Do Nothing.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT3 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT3 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTCR
register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

field.name: CTMODE
field.description: Counter/Timer Mode This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale Register.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Mode. Incremented every rising PCLK edge.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTER_MODE_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode rising edge. TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTER_MODE_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode falling edge. TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTER_MODE_DUAL_ED
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode dual edge. TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

field.name: CINSEL
field.description: Count Input Select When bits 1:0 in this register are not 00, these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected for a particular CAPn input in the CTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000. However, capture and/or interrupt can be selected for the other 3 CAPn inputs in the same timer.

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 0. CAPn.0 for TIMERn

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 1. CAPn.1 for TIMERn

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_2
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 2. CAPn.2 for TIMERn

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_3
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 3. CAPn.3 for TIMERn

field.name: ENCC
field.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

field.name: SELCC
field.description: Edge select. When bit 4 is 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x2 to 0x3 and 0x6 to 0x7 are reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_0_RISING_EDG
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 0 Rising Edge. Rising edge of the signal on capture channel 0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_0_FALLING_ED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 0 Falling Edge. Falling edge of the signal on capture channel 0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_1_RISING_EDG
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 1 Rising Edge. Rising edge of the signal on capture channel 1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_1_FALLING_ED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 1 Falling Edge. Falling edge of the signal on capture channel 1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_2_RISING_EDG
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 2 Rising Edge. Rising edge of the signal on capture channel 2 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_2_FALLING_ED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 2 Falling Edge. Falling edge of the signal on capture channel 2 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: PWMC
register.description: PWM Control Register. The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins.

field.name: PWMEN0
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel0.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CT32Bn_MAT0 is controlled by EM0.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT0.

field.name: PWMEN1
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel1.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CT32Bn_MAT01 is controlled by EM1.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT1.

field.name: PWMEN2
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel2.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CT32Bn_MAT2 is controlled by EM2.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT2.

field.name: PWMEN3
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel3. Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CT32Bn_MAT3 is controlled by EM3.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CT132Bn_MAT3.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: INT
field.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_REQUEST
enumeratedValue.description: No request. No interrupt request is pending.

enumeratedValue.name: REQUEST_ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Request active. Interrupt request is active.

field.name: COMB
field.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: Or. OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: And. AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Group interrupt trigger

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE_TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Edge-triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Level-triggered.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: PORT_POL%s
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

field.name: POL
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port m pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin PIOm_n of port m. 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

register.name: PORT_ENA%s
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 enable register

field.name: ENA
field.description: Enable port 0 pin for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin Pm_n of port m. 0 = the port 0 pin is disabled and does not contribute to the grouped interrupt. 1 = the port 0 pin is enabled and contributes to the grouped interrupt.

peripheral.name: PINT
peripheral.description: Pin interrupt and pattern match engine

field.name: PMODE
field.description: Selects the interrupt mode for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Edge sensitive 1 = Level sensitive

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: IENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENRL
field.description: Enables the rising edge or level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written..

register.name: SIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENR, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: CIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level (rising edge interrupt) clear register

field.name: CENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address clear bits in the IENR, thus disabling the interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: IENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENAF
field.description: Enables the falling edge or configures the active level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable falling edge interrupt or set active interrupt level LOW. 1 = Enable falling edge interrupt enabled or set active interrupt level HIGH.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: SIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENF, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Select HIGH-active interrupt or enable falling edge interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: CIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt clear register

field.name: CENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address clears bits in the IENF, thus disabling interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = LOW-active interrupt selected or falling edge interrupt disabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RDET
field.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No rising edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a rising edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear rising edge detection for this pin.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: FDET
field.description: Falling edge detect. Bit n detects the falling edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No falling edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a falling edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear falling edge detection for this pin.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: PSTAT
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: SEL_PMATCH
field.description: Specifies whether the 8 pin interrupts are controlled by the pin interrupt function or by the pattern match function.

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pin interrupt. Interrupts are driven in response to the standard pin interrupt function.

enumeratedValue.name: PATTERN_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Pattern match. Interrupts are driven in response to pattern matches.

field.name: ENA_RXEV
field.description: Enables the RXEV output to the CPU and/or to a GPIO output when the specified boolean expression evaluates to true.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. RXEV output to the CPU is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. RXEV output to the CPU is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Do not write 1s to unused bits.

field.name: PMAT
field.description: This field displays the current state of pattern matches. A 1 in any bit of this field indicates that the corresponding product term is matched by the current state of the appropriate inputs.

register.name: PMCFG
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit slice configuration register

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS0
field.description: Determines whether slice 0 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 0 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 0 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 0 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS1
field.description: Determines whether slice 1 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 1 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 1 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 1 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS2
field.description: Determines whether slice 2 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 2 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 2 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 2 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS3
field.description: Determines whether slice 3 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 3 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 3 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 3 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS4
field.description: Determines whether slice 4 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 4 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 4 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 4 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS5
field.description: Determines whether slice 5 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 5 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 5 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 5 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS6
field.description: Determines whether slice 6 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 6 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 6 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 6 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Bit slice 7 is automatically considered a product end point.

field.name: CFG0
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_OR_FAL
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

field.name: CFG1
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 1.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_OR_FAL
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

field.name: CFG2
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 2.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_OR_FAL
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

register.name: PIO0_%s
register.description: Digital I/O control for port 0 pins PIO0_0 to PIO0_15.

field.name: FUNC
field.description: Selects pin function.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Selects function mode (on-chip pull-up/pull-down resistor control).

enumeratedValue.name: INACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive. Inactive (no pull-down/pull-up resistor enabled).

enumeratedValue.name: PULL_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Pull-down. Pull-down resistor enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PULL_UP
enumeratedValue.description: Pull-up. Pull-up resistor enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: REPEATER
enumeratedValue.description: Repeater. Repeater mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: INVERT
field.description: Input polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Input function is not inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Input is function inverted.

field.name: DIGIMODE
field.description: Select Analog/Digital mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ANALOG_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Analog mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DIGITAL_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Digital mode.

field.name: FILTEROFF
field.description: Controls input glitch filter.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter enabled. Noise pulses below approximately 10 ns are filtered out

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter disabled. No input filtering is done

field.name: SLEW
field.description: Driver slew rate.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Standard mode, output slew rate control is enabled. More outputs can be switched simultaneously.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Fast mode, slew rate control is disabled. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

field.name: OD
field.description: Controls open-drain mode.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal. Normal push-pull output

enumeratedValue.name: OPEN_DRAIN
enumeratedValue.description: Open-drain. Simulated open-drain output (high drive disabled)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: I2CDRIVE
field.description: Controls the current sink capability of the pin.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_DRIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Low drive. Output drive sink is 4 mA. This is sufficient for standard and fast mode I2C.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_DRIVE
enumeratedValue.description: High drive. Output drive sink is 20 mA. This is needed for Fast Mode Plus I 2C. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

field.name: I2CFILTER
field.description: Configures I2C features for standard mode, fast mode, and Fast Mode Plus operation.

enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. I2C 50 ns glitch filter enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. I2C 50 ns glitch filter disabled.

field.name: DELAYVAL
field.description: Tick interval value. The delay will be equal to DELAYVAL + 1 periods of the timer clock. The minimum usable value is 1, for a delay of 2 timer clocks. A value of 0 stops the timer.

field.name: REPEAT
field.description: Repeat delay. 0 = One-time delay. 1 = Delay repeats continuously.

field.name: INTR
field.description: Interrupt flag. 0 = No interrupt is pending. 1 = An interrupt is pending. A write of any value to this register clears this flag.

field.name: ACTIVE
field.description: Active flag. 0 = The Micro-Tick Timer is stopped. 1 = The Micro-Tick Timer is currently active.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: BODRSTLEV
field.description: BOD reset level

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_0_1
enumeratedValue.description: Level 0: 1.5 V

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_1_1

enumeratedValue.description: Level 2: 2.0 V

field.name: BODINTVAL
field.description: BOD interrupt level

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_0_2
enumeratedValue.description: Level 0: 2.05 V

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_1_2
enumeratedValue.description: Level 1: 2.45 V

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_2_2
enumeratedValue.description: Level 2: 2.75 V

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_3_3
