field.name: BODRSTENA
field.description: BOD reset enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE_RESET_FUNCTI
enumeratedValue.description: Disable reset function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_RESET_FUNCTIO
enumeratedValue.description: Enable reset function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: MOD
register.description: Watchdog mode register. This register contains the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

field.name: WDEN
field.description: Watchdog enable bit. Once this bit is set to one and a watchdog feed is performed, the watchdog timer will run permanently.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop. The watchdog timer is stopped.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: Run. The watchdog timer is running.

field.name: WDRESET
field.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. Once this bit has been written with a 1 it cannot be re-written with a 0.

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt. A watchdog time-out will not cause a chip reset.

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Reset. A watchdog time-out will cause a chip reset.

field.name: WDTOF
field.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, by a feed error, or by events associated with WDPROTECT. Cleared by software. Causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1.

field.name: WDINT
field.description: Warning interrupt flag. Set when the timer reaches the value in WDWARNINT. Cleared by software.

field.name: WDPROTECT
field.description: Watchdog update mode. This bit can be set once by software and is only cleared by a reset.

enumeratedValue.name: FLEXIBLE
enumeratedValue.description: Flexible. The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed at any time.

enumeratedValue.name: THRESHOLD
enumeratedValue.description: Threshold. The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed only after the counter is below the value of WDWARNINT and WDWINDOW.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Once this bit is set to one and a watchdog feed is performed, disabling or powering down the watchdog oscillator is prevented by hardware. This bit can be set once by software and is only cleared by any reset.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: TC
register.description: Watchdog timer constant register. This 24-bit register determines the time-out value.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Watchdog time-out value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: FEED
register.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in WDTC.

field.name: FEED
field.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: TV
register.description: Watchdog timer value register. This 24-bit register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Counter timer value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: WARNINT
field.description: Watchdog warning interrupt compare value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, only zero should be written.

field.name: WINDOW
field.description: Watchdog window value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, only zero should be written.

field.name: SWRESET
field.description: Software reset control

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_IN_RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Not in reset. The RTC is not held in reset. This bit must be cleared prior to configuring or initiating any operation of the RTC.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_RESET
enumeratedValue.description: In reset. The RTC is held in reset. All register bits within the RTC will be forced to their reset value except the OFD bit. This bit must be cleared before writing to any register in the RTC - including writes to set any of the other bits within this register. Do not attempt to write to any bits of this register at the same time that the reset bit is being cleared.

field.name: OFD
field.description: Oscillator fail detect status.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: Run. The RTC oscillator is running properly. Writing a 0 has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: FAIL
enumeratedValue.description: Fail. RTC oscillator fail detected. Clear this flag after the following power-up. Writing a 1 clears this bit.

field.name: ALARM1HZ
field.description: RTC 1 Hz timer alarm flag status.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: No match. No match has occurred on the 1 Hz RTC timer. Writing a 0 has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. A match condition has occurred on the 1 Hz RTC timer. This flag generates an RTC alarm interrupt request RTC_ALARM which can also wake up the part from any low power mode. Writing a 1 clears this bit.

field.name: WAKE1KHZ
field.description: RTC 1 kHz timer wake-up flag status.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: Run. The RTC 1 kHz timer is running. Writing a 0 has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: Time-out. The 1 kHz high-resolution/wake-up timer has timed out. This flag generates an RTC wake-up interrupt request RTC-WAKE which can also wake up the part from any low power mode. Writing a 1 clears this bit.

field.name: ALARMDPD_EN
field.description: RTC 1 Hz timer alarm enable for Deep power-down.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. A match on the 1 Hz RTC timer will not bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. A match on the 1 Hz RTC timer bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

field.name: WAKEDPD_EN
field.description: RTC 1 kHz timer wake-up enable for Deep power-down.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. A match on the 1 kHz RTC timer will not bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. A match on the 1 kHz RTC timer bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

field.name: RTC1KHZ_EN
field.description: RTC 1 kHz clock enable. This bit can be set to 0 to conserve power if the 1 kHz timer is not used. This bit has no effect when the RTC is disabled (bit 7 of this register is 0).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. A match on the 1 kHz RTC timer will not bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. The 1 kHz RTC timer is enabled.

field.name: RTC_EN
field.description: RTC enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. The RTC 1 Hz and 1 kHz clocks are shut down and the RTC operation is disabled. This bit should be 0 when writing to load a value in the RTC counter register.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. The 1 Hz RTC clock is running and RTC operation is enabled. This bit must be set to initiate operation of the RTC. The first clock to the RTC counter occurs 1 s after this bit is set. To also enable the high-resolution, 1 kHz clock, set bit 6 in this register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MATVAL
field.description: Contains the match value against which the 1 Hz RTC timer will be compared to generate set the alarm flag RTC_ALARM and generate an alarm interrupt/wake-up if enabled.

field.name: VAL
field.description: A read reflects the current value of the main, 1 Hz RTC timer. A write loads a new initial value into the timer. The RTC counter will count up continuously at a 1 Hz rate once the RTC Software Reset is removed (by clearing bit 0 of the CTRL register). Only write to this register when the RTC_EN bit in the RTC CTRL Register is 0. The counter increments one second after the RTC_EN bit is set.

field.name: VAL
field.description: A read reflects the current value of the high-resolution/wake-up timer. A write pre-loads a start count value into the wake-up timer and initializes a count-down sequence. Do not write to this register while counting is in progress.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written..

field.name: INTPIN
field.description: Pin number select for pin interrupt or pattern match engine input. (PIO0_0 to PIO1_31 correspond to numbers 0 to 63).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: DMA_ITRIG_INMUX%s
register.description: Trigger select register for DMA channel 0

field.name: INP
field.description: Trigger input number (decimal value) for DMA channel n (n = 0 to 21). 0 = ADC0 Sequence A interrupt 1 = ADC0 Sequence B interrupt 2 = SCT0 DMA request 0 3 = SCT0 DMA request 1 4 = Timer 0 Match 0 5 = Timer 0 Match 1 6 = Timer 1 Match 0 7 = Timer 2 Match 0 8 = Timer 2 Match 1 9 = Timer 3 Match 0 10 = Timer 4 Match 0 11 = Timer 4 Match 1 12 = Pin interrupt 0 13 = Pin interrupt 1 14 = Pin interrupt 2 15 = Pin interrupt 3 16 = DMA output trigger mux 0 17 = DMA output trigger mux 1 18 = DMA output trigger mux 2 19 = DMA output trigger mux 3

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: DMA_OTRIG_INMUX%s
register.description: DMA output trigger selection to become DMA trigger 16

field.name: INP
field.description: DMA trigger output number (decimal value) for DMA channel n (n = 0 to 19).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: FREQMEAS_REF
register.description: Clock selection for frequency measurement function reference clock

field.name: CLKIN
field.description: Clock source number (decimal value) for frequency measure function target clock: 0 = System oscillator (MAIN_OSC) 1 = IRC oscillator 2 = Watchdog oscillator 3 = 32 kHz RTC oscillator 4 = Main clock (see Section 4.5.21) 5 = PIO0_4 6 = PIO0_20 7 = PIO0_24 8 = PIO1_4

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: FREQMEAS_TARGET
register.description: Clock selection for frequency measurement function target clock

field.name: CLKIN
field.description: Clock source number (decimal value) for frequency measure function target clock: 0 = System oscillator (MAIN_OSC) 1 = IRC oscillator 2 = Watchdog oscillator 3 = 32 kHz RTC oscillator 4 = Main clock (see Section 4.5.18) 5 = PIO0_4 6 = PIO0_20 7 = PIO0_24 8 = PIO1_4

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: COMPVAL
register.description: Compare value LSB register. Holds the 32 LSBs of the compare value.

field.name: RICOMP
field.description: Compare register. Holds the 32 LSBs of the value which is compared to the counter.

register.name: MASK
register.description: Mask LSB register. This register holds the 32 LSB s of the mask value. A 1 written to any bit will force the compare to be true for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register.

field.name: RIMASK
field.description: Mask register. This register holds the 32 LSBs of the mask value. A one written to any bit overrides the result of the comparison for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register (causes the comparison of the register bits to be always true).

field.name: RITINT
field.description: Interrupt flag

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: This bit is set to 1 by hardware whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of RICOMPVAL and RIMASK registers. Writing a 1 to this bit will clear it to 0. Writing a 0 has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: NOMTCH
enumeratedValue.description: The counter value does not equal the masked compare value.

field.name: RITENCLR
field.description: Timer enable clear

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: The timer will be cleared to 0 whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of COMPVAL/COMPVAL_H and MASK/MASK_H registers. This will occur on the same clock that sets the interrupt flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NOCLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: The timer will not be cleared to 0.

field.name: RITENBR
field.description: Timer enable for debug

enumeratedValue.name: HALT
enumeratedValue.description: The timer is halted when the processor is halted for debugging.

enumeratedValue.name: DEBUG
enumeratedValue.description: Debug has no effect on the timer operation.

field.name: RITEN
field.description: Timer enable.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled. This can be overruled by a debug halt if enabled in bit 2.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Timer disabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: COUNTER
register.description: Counter LSB register. 32 LSBs of the counter.

field.name: RICOUNTER
field.description: 32 LSBs of the up counter. Counts continuously unless RITEN bit in CTRL register is cleared or debug mode is entered (if enabled by the RITNEBR bit in RICTRL). Can be loaded to any value in software.

register.name: COMPVAL_H
register.description: Compare value MSB register. Holds the 16 MSBs of the compare value.

field.name: RICOMP
field.description: Compare value MSB register. Holds the 16 MSBs of the value which is compared to the counter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: MASK_H
register.description: Mask MSB register. This register holds the 16 MSBs of the mask value. A 1 written to any bit will force a compare on the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register.

field.name: RIMASK
field.description: Mask register. This register holds the 16 MSBs of the mask value. A one written to any bit overrides the result of the comparison for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register (causes the comparison of the register bits to be always true).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: COUNTER_H
register.description: Counter MSB register. 16 MSBs of the counter.

field.name: RICOUNTER
field.description: 16 LSBs of the up counter. Counts continuously unless RITEN bit in RICTRL register is cleared or debug mode is entered (if enabled by the RITNEBR bit in RICTRL). Can be loaded to any value in software.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTVAL%s
register.description: MRTn Time interval value register. This value is loaded into the TIMER0 register.

field.name: IVALUE
field.description: Time interval load value. This value is loaded into the TIMERn register and the MRT channel n starts counting down from IVALUE -1. If the timer is idle, writing a non-zero value to this bit field starts the timer immediately. If the timer is running, writing a zero to this bit field does the following: If LOAD = 1, the timer stops immediately. If LOAD = 0, the timer stops at the end of the time interval.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: LOAD
field.description: Determines how the timer interval value IVALUE -1 is loaded into the TIMERn register. This bit is write-only. Reading this bit always returns 0.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FORCE_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: No force load. The load from the INTVALn register to the TIMERn register is processed at the end of the time interval if the repeat mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: FORCE_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: Force load. The INTVALn interval value IVALUE -1 is immediately loaded into the TIMERn register while TIMERn is running.

register.name: TIMER%s
register.description: MRTn Timer register. This register reads the value of the down-counter.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: Holds the current timer value of the down-counter. The initial value of the TIMERn register is loaded as IVALUE - 1 from the INTVALn register either at the end of the time interval or immediately in the following cases: INTVALn register is updated in the idle state. INTVALn register is updated with LOAD = 1. When the timer is in idle state, reading this bit fields returns -1 (0x00FF FFFF).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTRL%s
register.description: MRTn Control register. This register controls the MRTn modes.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Enable the TIMERn interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: TIMERn interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: TIMERn interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Selects timer mode.

enumeratedValue.name: REPEAT_INTERRUPT_MOD
enumeratedValue.description: Repeat interrupt mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE_SHOT_INTERRUPT_M
enumeratedValue.description: One-shot interrupt mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE_SHOT_STALL_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: One-shot stall mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: INTFLAG
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pending interrupt. The interrupt is pending because TIMERn has reached the end of the time interval. If the INTEN bit in the CONTROLn is also set to 1, the interrupt for timer channel n and the global interrupt are raised. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the interrupt request.

field.name: RUN
field.description: Indicates the state of TIMERn. This bit is read-only.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_STATE
enumeratedValue.description: Idle state. TIMERn is stopped.

enumeratedValue.name: RUNNING
enumeratedValue.description: Running. TIMERn is running.

field.name: INUSE
field.description: Channel In Use flag. Operating details depend on the MULTITASK bit in the MODCFG register, and affects the use of IDLE_CH.

enumeratedValue.name: NO
enumeratedValue.description: This channel is not in use.

enumeratedValue.name: YES
enumeratedValue.description: This channel is in use.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: MODCFG
register.description: Module Configuration register. This register provides information about this particular MRT instance, and allows choosing an overall mode for the idle channel feature.

field.name: NOC
field.description: Identifies the number of channels in this MRT.

field.name: NOB
field.description: Identifies the number of timer bits in this MRT.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MULTITASK
field.description: Selects the operating mode for the INUSE flags and the IDLE_CH register. See Idle channel register (IDLE_CH) for details.

enumeratedValue.name: HARDWARE_STATUS_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware status mode. In this mode, the INUSE(n) flags for all channels are reset.

enumeratedValue.name: MULTI_TASK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Multi-task mode.

register.name: IDLE_CH
register.description: Idle channel register. This register returns the number of the first idle channel.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: CHAN
field.description: Idle channel. Reading the CHAN bits, returns the lowest idle timer channel. The number is positioned such that it can be used as an offset from the MRT base address in order to access the registers for the allocated channel. If all timer channels are running, CHAN = 0xF. See text above for more details.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: GFLAG0
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER0.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pending interrupt. The interrupt is pending because TIMER0 has reached the end of the time interval. If the INTEN bit in the CONTROL0 register is also set to 1, the interrupt for timer channel 0 and the global interrupt are raised. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the interrupt request.

field.name: GFLAG1
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER1. See description of channel 0.

field.name: GFLAG2
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER2. See description of channel 0.

field.name: GFLAG3
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER3. See description of channel 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.description: Reserved

field.name: FRG0

field.name: ARST_SET
field.description: Writing ones to this register sets the corresponding bit or bits in the AYSNCPRESETCTRL register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in AYSNCPRESETCTRL are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bit or bits in the AYSNCPRESETCTRL register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in AYSNCPRESETCTRL are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_1_2
enumeratedValue.description: Level 1: 2.45 V

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_2_2
enumeratedValue.description: Level 2: 2.75 V

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL_3_3
enumeratedValue.description: Level 3: 3.05 V

field.name: BODRSTENA
field.description: BOD reset enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE_RESET_FUNCTI
enumeratedValue.description: Disable reset function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_RESET_FUNCTIO
enumeratedValue.description: Enable reset function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: CFG
register.description: USART Configuration register. Basic USART configuration settings that typically are not changed during operation.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: USART Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset. While Enable = 0, all USART interrupts and DMA transfers are disabled. When Enable is set again, CFG and most other control bits remain unchanged. For instance, when re-enabled, the USART will immediately generate a TxRdy interrupt (if enabled in the INTENSET register) or a DMA transfer request because the transmitter has been reset and is therefore available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART is enabled for operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Selects the data size for the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 7 bit Data length.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 8 bit Data length.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bit data length. The 9th bit is commonly used for addressing in multidrop mode. See the ADDRDET bit in the CTL register.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved.

field.name: PARITYSEL
field.description: Selects what type of parity is used by the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: No parity.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is even, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be even.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is odd, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be odd.

field.name: STOPLEN
field.description: Number of stop bits appended to transmitted data. Only a single stop bit is required for received data.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_STOP_BIT
enumeratedValue.description: 1 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits. This setting should only be used for asynchronous communication.

field.name: MODE32K
field.description: Selects standard or 32 kHz clocking mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART uses standard clocking.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. USART uses the 32 kHz clock from the RTC oscillator as the clock source to the BRG, and uses a special bit clocking scheme.

field.name: LINMODE
field.description: LIN break mode enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Break detect and generate is configured for normal operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Break detect and generate is configured for LIN bus operation.

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS Enable. Determines whether CTS is used for flow control. CTS can be from the input pin, or from the USART's own RTS if loopback mode is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FLOW_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: No flow control. The transmitter does not receive any automatic flow control signal.

enumeratedValue.name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control enabled. The transmitter uses the CTS input (or RTS output in loopback mode) for flow control purposes.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SYNCEN
field.description: Selects synchronous or asynchronous operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Asynchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SYNCHRONOUS_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronous mode.

field.name: CLKPOL
field.description: Selects the clock polarity and sampling edge of received data in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SYNCMST
field.description: Synchronous mode Master select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a slave.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Master. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a master.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Selects data loopback mode.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_OPERATION
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPBACK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback mode. This provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing for USART data. Serial data from the transmitter (Un_TXD) is connected internally to serial input of the receive (Un_RXD). Un_TXD and Un_RTS activity will also appear on external pins if these functions are configured to appear on device pins. The receiver RTS signal is also looped back to CTS and performs flow control if enabled by CTSEN.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description: I/O output mode.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. USART output and input operate in standard fashion.

enumeratedValue.name: IRDA
enumeratedValue.description: IrDA. USART output and input operate in IrDA mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OETA
field.description: Output Enable Turnaround time enable for RS-485 operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal deasserted at the end of the last stop bit of a transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal remains asserted for one character time after the end of the last stop bit of a transmission. OE will also remain asserted if another transmit begins before it is deasserted.

field.name: AUTOADDR
field.description: Automatic Address matching enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by software. This provides the possibility of versatile addressing (e.g. respond to more than one address).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by hardware, using the value in the ADDR register as the address to match.

field.name: OESEL
field.description: Output Enable Select.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RTS signal is used as the standard flow control function.

enumeratedValue.name: RS_485
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485. The RTS signal configured to provide an output enable signal to control an RS-485 transceiver.

field.name: OEPOL
field.description: Output Enable Polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active high.

field.name: RXPOL
field.description: Receive data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RX signal is used as it arrives from the pin. This means that the RX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The RX signal is inverted before being used by the USART. This means that the RX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: TXPOL
field.description: Transmit data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The TX signal is sent out without change. This means that the TX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The TX signal is inverted by the USART before being sent out. This means that the TX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTL
register.description: USART Control register. USART control settings that are more likely to change during operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXBRKEN
field.description: Break Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_OPERATION
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_BREAK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous break. Continuous break is sent immediately when this bit is set, and remains until this bit is cleared. A break may be sent without danger of corrupting any currently transmitting character if the transmitter is first disabled (TXDIS in CTL is set) and then waiting for the transmitter to be disabled (TXDISINT in STAT = 1) before writing 1 to TXBRKEN.

field.name: ADDRDET
field.description: Enable address detect mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART presents all incoming data.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART receiver ignores incoming data that does not have the most significant bit of the data (typically the 9th bit) = 1. When the data MSB bit = 1, the receiver treats the incoming data normally, generating a received data interrupt. Software can then check the data to see if this is an address that should be handled. If it is, the ADDRDET bit is cleared by software and further incoming data is handled normally.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXDIS
field.description: Transmit Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Not disabled. USART transmitter is not disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART transmitter is disabled after any character currently being transmitted is complete. This feature can be used to facilitate software flow control.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: CC
field.description: Continuous Clock generation. By default, SCLK is only output while data is being transmitted in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_ON_CHARACTER
enumeratedValue.description: Clock on character. In synchronous mode, SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on Un_TXD or to complete a character that is being received.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous clock. SCLK runs continuously in synchronous mode, allowing characters to be received on Un_RxD independently from transmission on Un_TXD).

field.name: CLRCCONRX
field.description: Clear Continuous Clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. No effect on the CC bit.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-clear. The CC bit is automatically cleared when a complete character has been received. This bit is cleared at the same time.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: AUTOBAUD
field.description: Autobaud enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART is in normal operating mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. USART is in autobaud mode. This bit should only be set when the USART receiver is idle. The first start bit of RX is measured and used the update the BRG register to match the received data rate. AUTOBAUD is cleared once this process is complete, or if there is an AERR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: STAT
register.description: USART Status register. The complete status value can be read here. Writing ones clears some bits in the register. Some bits can be cleared by writing a 1 to them.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT or RXDATSTAT registers.

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: Receiver Idle. When 0, indicates that the receiver is currently in the process of receiving data. When 1, indicates that the receiver is not currently in the process of receiving data.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT. Set when the data is moved from the transmit buffer to the transmit shift register.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle. When 0, indicates that the transmitter is currently in the process of sending data.When 1, indicate that the transmitter is not currently in the process of sending data.

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit reflects the current state of the CTS signal, regardless of the setting of the CTSEN bit in the CFG register. This will be the value of the CTS input pin unless loopback mode is enabled.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state is detected for the CTS flag above. This bit is cleared by software.

field.name: TXDISSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Status flag. When 1, this bit indicates that the USART transmitter is fully idle after being disabled via the TXDIS bit in the CFG register (TXDIS = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a new character is received while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the newly received character in the shift register is lost.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXBRK
field.description: Received Break. This bit reflects the current state of the receiver break detection logic. It is set when the Un_RXD pin remains low for 16 bit times. Note that FRAMERRINT will also be set when this condition occurs because the stop bit(s) for the character would be missing. RXBRK is cleared when the Un_RXD pin goes high.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs. Cleared by software.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input. Its purpose is primarily to allow wake-up from Deep-sleep or Power-down mode immediately when a start is detected. Cleared by software.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a character is received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a parity error is detected in a received character..

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag. Three samples of received data are taken in order to determine the value of each received data bit, except in synchronous mode. This acts as a noise filter if one sample disagrees. This flag is set when a received data bit contains one disagreeing sample. This could indicate line noise, a baud rate or character format mismatch, or loss of synchronization during data reception.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Auto baud Error. An auto baud error can occur if the BRG counts to its limit before the end of the start bit that is being measured, essentially an auto baud time-out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set register. Contains an individual interrupt enable bit for each potential USART interrupt. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a received character available to be read from the RXDAT register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the TXDAT register is available to take another character to transmit.

field.name: TXIDLEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter becomes idle (TXIDLE = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTSEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a change in the state of the CTS input.

field.name: TXDISEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter is fully disabled as indicated by the TXDISINT flag in STAT. See description of the TXDISINT bit for details.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an overrun error occurred.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRKEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a change of state has occurred in the detection of a received break condition (break condition asserted or deasserted).

field.name: STARTEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a received start bit has been detected.

field.name: FRAMERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a framing error has been detected.

field.name: PARITYERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a parity error has been detected.

field.name: RXNOISEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when noise is detected. See description of the RXNOISEINT bit in Table 311.

field.name: ABERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an auto baud error occurs.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear register. Allows clearing any combination of bits in the INTENSET register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXIDLECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTSCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXDISCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRKCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: STARTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: FRAMERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: PARITYERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXNOISECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: ABERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: RXDAT
register.description: Receiver Data register. Contains the last character received.

field.name: DATA
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RXDATSTAT
register.description: Receiver Data with Status register. Combines the last character received with the current USART receive status. Allows DMA or software to recover incoming data and status together.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will set when the character in RXDAT was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag. See description of the RxNoiseInt bit in Table 311.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TXDAT
register.description: Transmit Data register. Data to be transmitted is written here.

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Data Register causes the data to be transmitted as soon as the transmit shift register is available and any conditions for transmitting data are met: CTS low (if CTSEN bit = 1), TXDIS bit = 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only zero should be written.

register.name: BRG
register.description: Baud Rate Generator register. 16-bit integer baud rate divisor value.

field.name: BRGVAL
field.description: This value is used to divide the USART input clock to determine the baud rate, based on the input clock from the FRG. 0 = The FRG clock is used directly by the USART function. 1 = The FRG clock is divided by 2 before use by the USART function. 2 = The FRG clock is divided by 3 before use by the USART function. ... 0xFFFF = The FRG clock is divided by 65,536 before use by the USART function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status register. Reflects interrupts that are currently enabled.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle status.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of the CTS input is detected.

field.name: TXDISINT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag.

field.name: ABERRINT
field.description: Auto baud Error Interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversample selection register for asynchronous communication.

field.name: OSRVAL
field.description: Oversample Selection Value. 0 to 3 = not supported 0x4 = 5 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0x5 = 6 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. ... 0xF= 16 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: ADDR
register.description: Address register for automatic address matching.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: 8-bit address used with automatic address matching. Used when address detection is enabled (ADDRDET in CTL = 1) and automatic address matching is enabled (AUTOADDR in CFG = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: MSTEN
field.description: Master Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Master function are not changed, but the Master function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C Master function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C Master function is enabled.

field.name: SLVEN
field.description: Slave Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Slave function are not changed, but the Slave function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C slave function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C slave function is enabled.

field.name: MONEN
field.description: Monitor Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Monitor function are not changed, but the Monitor function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C monitor function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C monitor function is enabled.

field.name: TIMEOUTEN
field.description: I2C bus Time-out Enable. When disabled, the time-out function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Time-out function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Time-out function is enabled. Both types of time-out flags will be generated and will cause interrupts if they are enabled. Typically, only one time-out will be used in a system.

field.name: MONCLKSTR
field.description: Monitor function Clock Stretching.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The monitor function will not perform clock stretching. Software or DMA may not always be able to read data provided by the monitor function before it is overwritten. This mode may be used when non-invasive monitoring is critical.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The monitor function will perform clock stretching in order to ensure that software or DMA can read all incoming data supplied by the monitor function.

field.name: HSCAPABLE
field.description: High-speed mode Capable enable. Since High Speed mode alters the way I2C pins drive and filter, as well as the timing for certain I2C signalling, enabling High-speed mode applies to all functions: master, slave, and monitor.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST_MODE_PLUS
enumeratedValue.description: Fast-mode plus. The I2C block will support Standard-mode, Fast-mode, and Fast-mode Plus, to the extent that the pin electronics support these modes. Any changes that need to be made to the pin controls, such as changing the drive strength or filtering, must be made by software via the IOCON register associated with each I2C pin,

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_SPEED
enumeratedValue.description: High-speed. In addition to Standard-mode, Fast-mode, and Fast-mode Plus, the I 2C block will support High-speed mode to the extent that the pin electronics support these modes. See Section 23.7.1.2 for more information.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: STAT
register.description: Status register for Master, Slave, and Monitor functions.

field.name: MSTPENDING
field.description: Master Pending. Indicates that the Master is waiting to continue communication on the I2C-bus (pending) or is idle. When the master is pending, the MSTSTATE bits indicate what type of software service if any the master expects. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if, enabled via the INTENSET register. The MSTPENDING flag is not set when the DMA is handling an event (if the MSTDMA bit in the MSTCTL register is set). If the master is in the idle state, and no communication is needed, mask this interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumeratedValue.description: In progress. Communication is in progress and the Master function is busy and cannot currently accept a command.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. The Master function needs software service or is in the idle state. If the master is not in the idle state, it is waiting to receive or transmit data or the NACK bit.

field.name: MSTSTATE
field.description: Master State code. The master state code reflects the master state when the MSTPENDING bit is set, that is the master is pending or in the idle state. Each value of this field indicates a specific required service for the Master function. All other values are reserved. See Table 346 for details of state values and appropriate responses.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Idle. The Master function is available to be used for a new transaction.

enumeratedValue.name: RECEIVE_READY
enumeratedValue.description: Receive ready. Received data available (Master Receiver mode). Address plus Read was previously sent and Acknowledged by slave.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSMIT_READY
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit ready. Data can be transmitted (Master Transmitter mode). Address plus Write was previously sent and Acknowledged by slave.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK_ADDRESS
enumeratedValue.description: NACK Address. Slave NACKed address.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: NACK Data. Slave NACKed transmitted data.

field.name: MSTARBLOSS
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss flag. This flag can be cleared by software writing a 1 to this bit. It is also cleared automatically a 1 is written to MSTCONTINUE.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ARBITRATION_LOSS
enumeratedValue.description: No Arbitration Loss has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: ARBITRATION_LOSS
enumeratedValue.description: Arbitration loss. The Master function has experienced an Arbitration Loss. At this point, the Master function has already stopped driving the bus and gone to an idle state. Software can respond by doing nothing, or by sending a Start in order to attempt to gain control of the bus when it next becomes idle.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error flag. This flag can be cleared by software writing a 1 to this bit. It is also cleared automatically a 1 is written to MSTCONTINUE.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_STARTSTOP_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No Start/Stop Error has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_MASTER_FUNCTION
enumeratedValue.description: The Master function has experienced a Start/Stop Error. A Start or Stop was detected at a time when it is not allowed by the I2C specification. The Master interface has stopped driving the bus and gone to an idle state, no action is required. A request for a Start could be made, or software could attempt to insure that the bus has not stalled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVPENDING
field.description: Slave Pending. Indicates that the Slave function is waiting to continue communication on the I2C-bus and needs software service. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via INTENSET. The SLVPENDING flag is not set when the DMA is handling an event (if the SLVDMA bit in the SLVCTL register is set). The SLVPENDING flag is read-only and is automatically cleared when a 1 is written to the SLVCONTINUE bit in the MSTCTL register. The point in time when SlvPending is set depends on whether the I2C block is in HSCAPABLE mode. See Section 23.7.1.2.2. When the I2C block is configured to be HSCAPABLE, HS master codes are detected automatically. Due to the requirements of the HS I2C specification, slave addresses must also be detected automatically, since the address must be acknowledged before the clock can be stretched.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumeratedValue.description: In progress. The Slave function does not currently need service.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. The Slave function needs service. Information on what is needed can be found in the adjacent SLVSTATE field.

field.name: SLVSTATE
field.description: Slave State code. Each value of this field indicates a specific required service for the Slave function. All other values are reserved. See Table 347 for state values and actions.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_ADDRESS
enumeratedValue.description: Slave address. Address plus R/W received. At least one of the four slave addresses has been matched by hardware.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_RECEIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave receive. Received data is available (Slave Receiver mode).

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_TRANSMIT
enumeratedValue.description: Slave transmit. Data can be transmitted (Slave Transmitter mode).

field.name: SLVNOTSTR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching. Indicates when the slave function is stretching the I2C clock. This is needed in order to gracefully invoke Deep Sleep or Power-down modes during slave operation. This read-only flag reflects the slave function status in real time.

enumeratedValue.name: STRETCHING
enumeratedValue.description: Stretching. The slave function is currently stretching the I2C bus clock. Deep-Sleep or Power-down mode cannot be entered at this time.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_STRETCHING
enumeratedValue.description: Not stretching. The slave function is not currently stretching the I 2C bus clock. Deep-sleep or Power-down mode could be entered at this time.

field.name: SLVIDX
field.description: Slave address match Index. This field is valid when the I2C slave function has been selected by receiving an address that matches one of the slave addresses defined by any enabled slave address registers, and provides an identification of the address that was matched. It is possible that more than one address could be matched, but only one match can be reported here.

enumeratedValue.name: ADDRESS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Address 0. Slave address 0 was matched.

enumeratedValue.name: ADDRESS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Address 1. Slave address 1 was matched.

enumeratedValue.name: ADDRESS_2
enumeratedValue.description: Address 2. Slave address 2 was matched.

enumeratedValue.name: ADDRESS_3
enumeratedValue.description: Address 3. Slave address 3 was matched.

field.name: SLVSEL
field.description: Slave selected flag. SLVSEL is set after an address match when software tells the Slave function to acknowledge the address. It is cleared when another address cycle presents an address that does not match an enabled address on the Slave function, when slave software decides to NACK a matched address, or when there is a Stop detected on the bus. SLVSEL is not cleared if software NACKs data.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not selected. The Slave function is not currently selected.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Selected. The Slave function is currently selected.

field.name: SLVDESEL
field.description: Slave Deselected flag. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via INTENSET. This flag can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DESELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not deselected. The Slave function has not become deselected. This does not mean that it is currently selected. That information can be found in the SLVSEL flag.

enumeratedValue.name: DESELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Deselected. The Slave function has become deselected. This is specifically caused by the SLVSEL flag changing from 1 to 0. See the description of SLVSEL for details on when that event occurs.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Monitor Ready. This flag is cleared when the MONRXDAT register is read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: No data. The Monitor function does not currently have data available.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_WAITING
enumeratedValue.description: Data waiting. The Monitor function has data waiting to be read.

field.name: MONOV
field.description: Monitor Overflow flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_OVERRUN
enumeratedValue.description: No overrun. Monitor data has not overrun.

enumeratedValue.name: OVERRUN
enumeratedValue.description: Overrun. A Monitor data overrun has occurred. This can only happen when Monitor clock stretching not enabled via the MONCLKSTR bit in the CFG register. Writing 1 to this bit clears the flag.

field.name: MONACTIVE
field.description: Monitor Active flag. Indicates when the Monitor function considers the I 2C bus to be active. Active is defined here as when some Master is on the bus: a bus Start has occurred more recently than a bus Stop.

enumeratedValue.name: INACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive. The Monitor function considers the I2C bus to be inactive.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Active. The Monitor function considers the I2C bus to be active.

field.name: MONIDLE
field.description: Monitor Idle flag. This flag is set when the Monitor function sees the I2C bus change from active to inactive. This can be used by software to decide when to process data accumulated by the Monitor function. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via the INTENSET register. The flag can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Not idle. The I2C bus is not idle, or this flag has been cleared by software.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Idle. The I2C bus has gone idle at least once since the last time this flag was cleared by software.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUT
field.description: Event Time-out Interrupt flag. Indicates when the time between events has been longer than the time specified by the TIMEOUT register. Events include Start, Stop, and clock edges. The flag is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. No time-out is created when the I2C-bus is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: No time-out. I2C bus events have not caused a time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT_TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: Event time-out. The time between I2C bus events has been longer than the time specified by the I2C TIMEOUT register.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUT
field.description: SCL Time-out Interrupt flag. Indicates when SCL has remained low longer than the time specific by the TIMEOUT register. The flag is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: No time-out. SCL low time has not caused a time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: Time-out. SCL low time has caused a time-out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable Set and read register.

field.name: MSTPENDINGEN
field.description: Master Pending interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MstPending interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MstPending interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTARBLOSSEN
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MstArbLoss interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MstArbLoss interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERREN
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MstStStpErr interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MstStStpErr interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVPENDINGEN
field.description: Slave Pending interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SlvPending interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SlvPending interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVNOTSTREN
field.description: Slave Not Stretching interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SlvNotStr interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SlvNotStr interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVDESELEN
field.description: Slave Deselect interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SlvDeSel interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SlvDeSel interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MONRDYEN
field.description: Monitor data Ready interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MonRdy interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MonRdy interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MONOVEN
field.description: Monitor Overrun interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MonOv interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MonOv interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MONIDLEEN
field.description: Monitor Idle interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MonIdle interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MonIdle interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUTEN
field.description: Event time-out interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The Event time-out interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The Event time-out interrupt is enabled.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUTEN
field.description: SCL time-out interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SCL time-out interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SCL time-out interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTPENDINGCLR
field.description: Master Pending interrupt clear. Writing 1 to this bit clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register if implemented.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTARBLOSSCLR
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERRCLR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVPENDINGCLR
field.description: Slave Pending interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVNOTSTRCLR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVDESELCLR
field.description: Slave Deselect interrupt clear.

field.name: MONRDYCLR
field.description: Monitor data Ready interrupt clear.

field.name: MONOVCLR
field.description: Monitor Overrun interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MONIDLECLR
field.description: Monitor Idle interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUTCLR
field.description: Event time-out interrupt clear.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUTCLR
field.description: SCL time-out interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TOMIN
field.description: Time-out time value, bottom four bits. These are hard-wired to 0xF. This gives a minimum time-out of 16 I2C function clocks and also a time-out resolution of 16 I2C function clocks.

field.name: TO
field.description: Time-out time value. Specifies the time-out interval value in increments of 16 I2C function clocks, as defined by the CLKDIV register. To change this value while I 2C is in operation, disable all time-outs, write a new value to TIMEOUT, then re-enable time-outs. 0x000 = A time-out will occur after 16 counts of the I2C function clock. 0x001 = A time-out will occur after 32 counts of the I2C function clock. ... 0xFFF = A time-out will occur after 65,536 counts of the I2C function clock.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CLKDIV
register.description: Clock pre-divider for the entire I2C block. This determines what time increments are used for the MSTTIME register, and controls some timing of the Slave function.

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: This field controls how the clock (PCLK) is used by the I2C functions that need an internal clock in order to operate. 0x0000 = PCLK is used directly by the I2C. 0x0001 = PCLK is divided by 2 before use. 0x0002 = PCLK is divided by 3 before use. ... 0xFFFF = PCLK is divided by 65,536 before use.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt Status register for Master, Slave, and Monitor functions.

field.name: MSTPENDING
field.description: Master Pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: MSTARBLOSS
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVPENDING
field.description: Slave Pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVNOTSTR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching status.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVDESEL
field.description: Slave Deselected flag.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Monitor Ready.

field.name: MONOV
field.description: Monitor Overflow flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MONIDLE
field.description: Monitor Idle flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUT
field.description: Event time-out Interrupt flag.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUT
field.description: SCL time-out Interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTCONTINUE
field.description: Master Continue. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUE
enumeratedValue.description: Continue. Informs the Master function to continue to the next operation. This must done after writing transmit data, reading received data, or any other housekeeping related to the next bus operation.

field.name: MSTSTART
field.description: Master Start control. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: Start. A Start will be generated on the I2C bus at the next allowed time.

field.name: MSTSTOP
field.description: Master Stop control. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop. A Stop will be generated on the I2C bus at the next allowed time, preceded by a NACK to the slave if the master is receiving data from the slave (Master Receiver mode).

field.name: MSTDMA
field.description: Master DMA enable. Data operations of the I2C can be performed with DMA. Protocol type operations such as Start, address, Stop, and address match must always be done with software, typically via an interrupt. When a DMA data transfer is complete, MSTDMA must be cleared prior to beginning the next operation, typically a Start or Stop.This bit is read/write.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. No DMA requests are generated for master operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. A DMA request is generated for I2C master data operations. When this I2C master is generating Acknowledge bits in Master Receiver mode, the acknowledge is generated automatically.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSCLLOW
field.description: Master SCL Low time. Specifies the minimum low time that will be asserted by this master on SCL. Other devices on the bus (masters or slaves) could lengthen this time. This corresponds to the parameter tLOW in the I2C bus specification. I2C bus specification parameters tBUF and t SU;STA have the same values and are also controlled by MSTSCLLOW.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 2 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 3_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 3 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 4_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 4 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 4 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 5_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 5 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 6 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 7 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 8 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: MSTSCLHIGH
field.description: Master SCL High time. Specifies the minimum high time that will be asserted by this master on SCL. Other masters in a multi-master system could shorten this time. This corresponds to the parameter tHIGH in the I2C bus specification. I2C bus specification parameters tSU;STO and tHD;STA have the same values and are also controlled by MSTSCLHIGH.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 2 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 3_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 3 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider .

enumeratedValue.name: 4_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 4 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 4 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 5_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 5 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 6 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 7 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 8 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: MSTDAT
register.description: Combined Master receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Master function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Master function. Write: transmit data using the Master function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVCONTINUE
field.description: Slave Continue.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUE
enumeratedValue.description: Continue. Informs the Slave function to continue to the next operation. This must be done after writing transmit data, reading received data, or any other housekeeping related to the next bus operation.

field.name: SLVNACK
field.description: Slave NACK.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK
enumeratedValue.description: NACK. Causes the Slave function to NACK the master when the slave is receiving data from the master (Slave Receiver mode).

field.name: SLVDMA
field.description: Slave DMA enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No DMA requests are issued for Slave mode operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. DMA requests are issued for I2C slave data transmission and reception.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: SLVDAT
register.description: Combined Slave receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Slave function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Slave function. Write: transmit data using the Slave function.

field.name: RESERVED
