field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SADISABLE
field.description: Slave Address n Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Slave Address n is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IGNORED_SLAVE_ADDRES
enumeratedValue.description: Ignored Slave Address n is ignored.

field.name: SLVADR
field.description: Slave Address. Seven bit slave address that is compared to received addresses if enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: QUALMODE0
field.description: Qualify mode for slave address 0.

enumeratedValue.name: MASK
enumeratedValue.description: Mask. The SLVQUAL0 field is used as a logical mask for matching address 0.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTEND
enumeratedValue.description: Extend. The SLVQUAL0 field is used to extend address 0 matching in a range of addresses.

field.name: SLVQUAL0
field.description: Slave address Qualifier for address 0. A value of 0 causes the address in SLVADR0 to be used as-is, assuming that it is enabled. If QUALMODE0 = 0, any bit in this field which is set to 1 will cause an automatic match of the corresponding bit of the received address when it is compared to the SLVADR0 register. If QUALMODE0 = 1, an address range is matched for address 0. This range extends from the value defined by SLVADR0 to the address defined by SLVQUAL0 (address matches when SLVADR0[7:1] <= received address <= SLVQUAL0[7:1]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MONRXDAT
field.description: Monitor function Receiver Data. This reflects every data byte that passes on the I2C pins.

field.name: MONSTART
field.description: Monitor Received Start.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_START_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: No start detected. The monitor function has not detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: START_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Start detected. The monitor function has detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

field.name: MONRESTART
field.description: Monitor Received Repeated Start.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_REPEATED_START_DE
enumeratedValue.description: No repeated start detected. The monitor function has not detected a Repeated Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: REPEATED_START_DETEC
enumeratedValue.description: Repeated start detected. The monitor function has detected a Repeated Start event on the I2C bus.

field.name: MONNACK
field.description: Monitor Received NACK.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the monitor function was acknowledged by at least one master or slave receiver.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the monitor function was not acknowledged by any receiver.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: SPI enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SPI is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SPI is enabled for operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MASTER
field.description: Master mode select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave mode. The SPI will operate in slave mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are inputs, MISO is an output.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Master mode. The SPI will operate in master mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are outputs, MISO is an input.

field.name: LSBF
field.description: LSB First mode enable.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. Data is transmitted and received in standard MSB first order.

enumeratedValue.name: REVERSE
enumeratedValue.description: Reverse. Data is transmitted and received in reverse order (LSB first).

field.name: CPHA
field.description: Clock Phase select.

enumeratedValue.name: CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: Change. The SPI captures serial data on the first clock transition of the transfer (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is changed on the following edge.

enumeratedValue.name: CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: Capture. The SPI changes serial data on the first clock transition of the transfer (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is captured on the following edge.

field.name: CPOL
field.description: Clock Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The rest state of the clock (between transfers) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The rest state of the clock (between transfers) is high.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Loopback mode enable. Loopback mode applies only to Master mode, and connects transmit and receive data connected together to allow simple software testing.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled.

field.name: SPOL0
field.description: SSEL0 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL0 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL0 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL0 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL0 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL0 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL0 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: SPOL1
field.description: SSEL1 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL1 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL1 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL1 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL1 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL1 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL1 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: SPOL2
field.description: SSEL2 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL2 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL2 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL2 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL2 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL2 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL2 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: SPOL3
field.description: SSEL3 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL3 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL3 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL3 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL3 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL3 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL3 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: PRE_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between SSEL assertion and the beginning of a data transfer. There is always one SPI clock time between SSEL assertion and the first clock edge. This is not considered part of the pre-delay. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. ... 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: POST_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between the end of a data transfer and SSEL deassertion. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. ... 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: FRAME_DELAY
field.description: If the EOF flag is set, controls the minimum amount of time between the current frame and the next frame (or SSEL deassertion if EOT). 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. ... 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: TRANSFER_DELAY
field.description: Controls the minimum amount of time that the SSEL is deasserted between transfers. 0x0 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 1 SPI clock time. (Zero added time.) 0x1 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 2 SPI clock times. 0x2 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 3 SPI clock times. ... 0xF = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 16 SPI clock times.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: STAT
register.description: SPI Status. Some status flags can be cleared by writing a 1 to that bit position

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT or TXDATCTL until the data is moved to the transmit shift register.

field.name: RXOV
field.description: Receiver Overrun interrupt flag. This flag applies only to slave mode (Master = 0). This flag is set when the beginning of a received character is detected while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the receiver buffer contents are preserved, and the incoming data is lost. Data received by the SPI should be considered undefined if RxOv is set.

field.name: TXUR
field.description: Transmitter Underrun interrupt flag. This flag applies only to slave mode (Master = 0). In this case, the transmitter must begin sending new data on the next input clock if the transmitter is idle. If that data is not available in the transmitter holding register at that point, there is no data to transmit and the TXUR flag is set. Data transmitted by the SPI should be considered undefined if TXUR is set.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert. This flag is set whenever any slave select transitions from deasserted to asserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become busy, and allows waking up the device from reduced power modes when a slave mode access begins. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert. This flag is set whenever any asserted slave selects transition to deasserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become idle. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: STALLED
field.description: Stalled status flag. This indicates whether the SPI is currently in a stall condition.

field.name: ENDTRANSFER
field.description: End Transfer control bit. Software can set this bit to force an end to the current transfer when the transmitter finishes any activity already in progress, as if the EOT flag had been set prior to the last transmission. This capability is included to support cases where it is not known when transmit data is written that it will be the end of a transfer. The bit is cleared when the transmitter becomes idle as the transfer comes to an end. Forcing an end of transfer in this manner causes any specified FRAME_DELAY and TRANSFER_DELAY to be inserted.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Master idle status flag. This bit is 1 whenever the SPI master function is fully idle. This means that the transmit holding register is empty and the transmitter is not in the process of sending data.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable read and Set. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: RX ready interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available in the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: TX ready interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated when data may be written to TXDAT.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: RX overrun interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a receiver overrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need for the receiver to move newly received data to the RXDAT register when it is already in use. The interface prevents receiver overrun in Master mode by not allowing a new transmission to begin when a receiver overrun would otherwise occur.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when a receiver overrun occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated if a receiver overrun occurs.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: TX underrun interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a transmitter underrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need to transmit data when none is available.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter underruns.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated if the transmitter underruns.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Slave select assert interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Slave select deassert interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTIDLEEN
field.description: Master idle interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when the SPI master function is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated when the SPI master function is idle.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable Clear. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit in INTENSET to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the MSTIDLE register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: Receiver Data. This contains the next piece of received data. The number of bits that are used depends on the LEN setting in TXCTL / TXDATCTL.

field.name: RXSSEL0_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL0 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL0 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL1_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL1 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL1 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL2_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL2 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL2 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL3_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL3 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL3 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: SOT
field.description: Start of Transfer flag. This flag will be 1 if this is the first data after the SSELs went from deasserted to asserted (i.e., any previous transfer has ended). This information can be used to identify the first piece of data in cases where the transfer length is greater than 16 bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 1 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: TXSSEL0_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL0 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL0 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL0_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL0 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL0_NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL0 not asserted.

field.name: TXSSEL1_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL1 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL1 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL1_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL1 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL1_NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL1 not asserted.

field.name: TXSSEL2_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL2 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL2 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL2_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL2 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL2_NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL2 not asserted.

field.name: TXSSEL3_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL3 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. The active state of the SSEL3 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL3_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL3 asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL3_NOT_ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL3 not asserted.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer. The asserted SSEL will be deasserted at the end of a transfer, and remain so for at least the time specified by the Transfer_delay value in the DLY register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_NOT_DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL not deasserted. This piece of data is not treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will not be deasserted at the end of this data.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL deasserted. This piece of data is treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will be deasserted at the end of this piece of data.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame. Between frames, a delay may be inserted, as defined by the FRAME_DELAY value in the DLY register. The end of a frame may not be particularly meaningful if the FRAME_DELAY value = 0. This control can be used as part of the support for frame lengths greater than 16 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_NOT_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data not EOF. This piece of data transmitted is not treated as the end of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data EOF. This piece of data is treated as the end of a frame, causing the FRAME_DELAY time to be inserted before subsequent data is transmitted.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore. This allows data to be transmitted using the SPI without the need to read unneeded data from the receiver.Setting this bit simplifies the transmit process and can be used with the DMA.

enumeratedValue.name: READ_RECEIVED_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: Read received data. Received data must be read in order to allow transmission to progress. In slave mode, an overrun error will occur if received data is not read before new data is received.

enumeratedValue.name: IGNORE_RECEIVED_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: Ignore received data. Received data is ignored, allowing transmission without reading unneeded received data. No receiver flags are generated.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: LEN
field.description: Data Length. Specifies the data length from 1 to 16 bits. Note that transfer lengths greater than 16 bits are supported by implementing multiple sequential transmits. 0x0 = Data transfer is 1 bit in length. 0x1 = Data transfer is 2 bits in length. 0x2 = Data transfer is 3 bits in length. ... 0xF = Data transfer is 16 bits in length.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 4 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only zero should be written.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXSSEL0_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 0.

field.name: TXSSEL1_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 1.

field.name: TXSSEL2_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 2.

field.name: TXSSEL3_n
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 3.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: LEN
field.description: Data transfer Length.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: Rate divider value. Specifies how the PCLK for the SPI is divided to produce the SPI clock rate in master mode. DIVVAL is -1 encoded such that the value 0 results in PCLK/1, the value 1 results in PCLK/2, up to the maximum possible divide value of 0xFFFF, which results in PCLK/65536.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag.

field.name: RXOV
field.description: Receiver Overrun interrupt flag.

field.name: TXUR
field.description: Transmitter Underrun interrupt flag.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Master Idle status flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.
